heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 08 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 9.9°C), outside temperature (down 9.1°C), and inside temperature (down 3.2°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in outside temperature (up 10.8°C), cloud levels (up 259 m), and inside temperature (up 3.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 273.5m lower than yesterday, 149.4m lower than the past week, 258.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 993m minimum and 2630m maximum, with an average of 1349.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1498.4m and 1607.7m.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; freezing temperatures are anticipated. Also, little or no wind. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dark. Weather should be calm and steady.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.6°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
